overview.title: What this blend is
overview.text: KLOW is GLOW with KPV added. KPV is a tripeptide fragment of alpha-MSH with potent anti-inflammatory action — particularly studied for gut inflammation and systemic cytokine reduction. Where GLOW focuses on structural repair, KLOW extends that with a dedicated anti-inflammatory layer. It's the choice when inflammation is as much of the problem as the tissue damage itself.

use_cases.title: Use cases (real-world)
use_cases.text: Use cases are framed as intent + context, not as a recommendation.
People usually consider blends when they’re trying to simplify decision-making, stack fewer vials, or chase a combined effect profile. The downside is more moving parts and more uncertainty.
If one component would be a bad fit for you (meds, history, side effects), the blend is also a bad fit — even if the other component seems appealing.

interaction_summary.title: Interaction summary
interaction_summary.text: Interaction flags are category prompts — not dosing instructions.
Blends inherit interaction risk from every component. If one component has a meaningful interaction class, treat the blend as having that interaction class.
If you’re on prescription meds (especially cardio, anticoagulant/antiplatelet, serotonergic, immunomodulating), treat uncertainty as a reason to slow down and verify with a clinician.

blend.rationale: KLOW is GLOW with KPV added. KPV is a tripeptide fragment of alpha-MSH with potent anti-inflammatory action — particularly studied for gut inflammation and systemic cytokine reduction. Where GLOW focuses on structural repair, KLOW extends that with a dedicated anti-inflammatory layer. It's the choice when inflammation is as much of the problem as the tissue damage itself.
blend.synergy_note: The GLOW components handle structural repair — BPC-157 for angiogenesis, TB-500 for cellular remodeling, GHK-Cu for collagen synthesis. KPV modulates the inflammatory environment those repairs are happening in. Less inflammation during active healing typically means faster and better-quality repair — the two effects are mutually reinforcing.
blend.who_its_for: IBD, gut inflammation, post-surgical recovery with significant inflammatory component, athletes dealing with both tissue damage and systemic inflammation.

component_roles.bpc-157: Angiogenesis driver — promotes blood supply to the injury site, protects and heals GI tissue
component_roles.tb-500: Systemic remodeler — drives cellular migration and extracellular matrix rebuilding
component_roles.ghk-cu: Collagen signal — stimulates collagen and elastin synthesis, anti-inflammatory support
component_roles.kpv: Anti-inflammatory — reduces cytokine-driven inflammation, particularly in gut tissue and systemically
